item.title: Google Dorks
item.description: What Is Google Dorks? It is basically an advanced google search! I have included four types of google dorks in this collection: Google dorks for SQL injection, Google dorks for Local File Inclusion, Google dorks For open CCTV cams and Google dorks for sensitive information. Copy and paste the below google dorks on the search engine and have fun! Google Dorks For SQL Injection: •inurl:index.php?id= •inurl:trainers.php?id= •inurl:buy.php?category= •inurl:article.php?ID= •inurl:play_old.php?id= •inurl:declaration_more.php?decl_id=

item.title: Reverse
item.description: Reversing : N.B. The stack “grows” down to lower memory addresses! ebp/rbp contains the address of the top of the current stack frame esp/rsp contains address of bottom of the current stack frame

item.title: Web CTF
item.description: http://pentest-tools.com/ https://www.shodan.io/ https://www.zoomeye.org/ https://censys.io https://crt.sh/ http://webscan.cc/ https://x.threatbook.cn/ https://dnsdumpster.com/ https://www.domainiq.com/reverse%5Fwhois https://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/web-sites-on-web-server/ https://www.robtex.com/dns-lookup/ https://phpinfo.me/bing.php https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Category:OWASP%5FDirBuster%5FProject https://github.com/laramies/theHarvester https://github.com/drwetter/testssl.sh https://github.com/urbanadventurer/WhatWeb https://buckets.grayhatwarfare.com/ Social Engineering https://leakedsource.ru/ https://www.shuju666.com/ http://www.pwsay.com/ http://www.mimayun.club/ http://leakbase.pw https://haveibeenpwned.com/ Crack http://cmd5.com https://somd5.com/ https://crackstation.net/ https://hashkiller.co.uk/ 其它 https://3v4l.org/ php eval https://github.com/denny0223/scrabble git https://github.com/lijiejie/ds%5Fstore%5Fexp .DS_Store https://github.com/kost/dvcs-ripper git / svn / hg / cvs … http://www.factordb.com/ unicode converter https://www.branah.com/unicode-converter PHP混淆 / 加密 http://enphp.djunny.com/ http://www.phpjm.net/ https://github.com/PowerShellMafia/PowerSploit https://github.com/swisskyrepo/PayloadsAllTheThings/ http://xssor.io https://github.com/Pgaijin66/XSS-Payloads/blob/master/payload.txt XSS Payloads DNSLog http://ceye.io https://www.t00ls.net/dnslog.html http://dnsbin.zhack.ca/ https://r12a.github.io/apps/encodings/ Encoding converter http://tool.leavesongs.com/

item.title: CTF New
item.description: CTF New attacks and tools: Hash extender attack: https://github.com/iagox86/hash%5Fextender Decrypt substitution cipher using guesses: https://quipqiup.com/ Xor cipher: python3 -m pip install –user xortool examples: xortool file.bin xortool -l 11 -c 20 file.bin xortool -x -c ’ ’ file.hex xortool -b -f -l 23 -t base64 message.enc The most common use is to pass just the encrypted file and the most frequent character (usually 00 for binaries and 20 for text files) - length will be automatically chosen:

item.title: CTF Resource
item.description: CTFs Crackstation.net : NTLM, md4, md5 hashes match with existing hashtable from crackstation Some useful commands: cat | head -n <line_number> | tail -1 : get n’th line_number strings reversing1 | egrep “^([A-Za-z0-9+/]{4})*([A-Za-z0-9+/]{2}==|[A-Za-z0-9+/]{3}=|[A-Za-z0-9+/]{4})$” | while read line ; do echo $line | base64 -d | cat -v && echo “”; done base64 encoded text regex echo “obase=16; <decimal_number>” | BC_LINE_LENGTH=0 bc | awk ‘{ print (length($0) % 2 == 0) ?
